Class Engine

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.is25am22new.Model.ComponentTiles.ComponentTile
it.polimi.ingsw.is25am22new.Model.ComponentTiles.Engine
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
DoubleEngine
public class Engine extends ComponentTile
Represents a specific type of component tile called Engine, which can rotate and have an activated engine on one or more sides. The Engine class extends the ComponentTile class and defines specialized behaviors such as engine activation and rotation of the engine sides.
See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Engine

      public Engine(String pngName, Side topSide, Side bottomSide, Side leftSide, Side rightSide)
      Constructs an Engine component tile with specified visual representation and side configurations. Initializes specific engine sides as active or inactive.
      Parameters:
      pngName - the name of the image file associated with the engine tile
      topSide - the configuration of the top side of the engine tile
      bottomSide - the configuration of the bottom side of the engine tile
      leftSide - the configuration of the left side of the engine tile
      rightSide - the configuration of the right side of the engine tile

    • activateComponent

      public void activateComponent()
      Activates the component associated with the specific subclass that implements this method. This method serves as a placeholder in the parent class and is intended to be overridden by subclasses to provide specific activation logic pertinent to the component. Subclasses should implement this method to define how their respective component functionality is initialized or triggered.
      Overrides:
      activateComponent in class ComponentTile

    • deactivateComponent

      public void deactivateComponent()
      Deactivates the functionality of a specific component within the game. This method is abstract and is intended to be implemented in subclasses, where it defines the specific logic for deactivating the component based on the component's nature and operational behavior. Subclasses should override this method to provide a concrete implementation tailored to the requirements of the respective component.
      Overrides:
      deactivateComponent in class ComponentTile

    • rotateClockwise

      public void rotateClockwise()
      Rotates the engine component 90 degrees clockwise and updates the state of the engine on each side of the component. This method rearranges the engine states by shifting them in a clockwise direction: - The state of the left side engine is assigned to the bottom side. - The state of the bottom side engine is assigned to the right side. - The state of the right side engine is assigned to the top side. - The state of the top side engine is assigned to the left side. The method also invokes the superclass implementation of the rotation functionality to ensure consistency with the base component tile logic. This reorientation is useful to update the directional configuration of the engine component.
      Overrides:
      rotateClockwise in class ComponentTile

    • rotateCounterClockwise

      public void rotateCounterClockwise()
      Rotates the engine component's side configurations counter-clockwise. This method updates the state of the engine's side-specific boolean flags by shifting their values counter-clockwise: - The left side's state becomes the top side's state. - The top side's state becomes the right side's state. - The right side's state becomes the bottom side's state. - The bottom side's state becomes the left side's state. Invokes the superclass's rotateCounterClockwise method to ensure the rotation logic is consistent with the parent class's implementation for other component tiles in the game environment.
      Overrides:
      rotateCounterClockwise in class ComponentTile

    • isTopSideEngine

      public boolean isTopSideEngine()

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the Engine object, indicating the type of engine (if present) and the state of its sides. The output format includes the class name and specifies which side, if any, has an engine: - "Top", "Bottom", "Left", or "Right" are used to represent the sides. - The side with an engine is labeled as "Engine". - If no engine is present, an empty string is returned.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string describing the engine's configuration or an empty string if no side has an engine

    • getDrawableTUI

      public DrawableComponentTileTUI getDrawableTUI()
      Returns a drawable representation of the Engine object for a text-based user interface (TUI). The returned object is responsible for generating a visual structure of the Engine's state and its side configurations in a textual format.
      Overrides:
      getDrawableTUI in class ComponentTile
      Returns:
      an instance of DrawableEngineTUI, which provides the textual representation of the Engine object for the TUI.

    • getDrawable

      public DrawableComponentTile getDrawable()

      Specified by:

      Returns:
